questions.text: What is the definition of “Machine Unlearning”?
options: Removing the influences of training data from a trained model
The ability of a machine learning model to adapt to new data
A technique used to compress machine learning models
The ability of a machine learning model to learn a variety of data
questions.correctAnswer: Removing the influences of training data from a trained model

questions.text: What might be some types of information that one might want to remove from model data? (Select all that apply.)
questions.correctAnswer:
Private data
Toxic or unsafe content
Stale knowledge

questions.text: What is GDPR’s Article 17 about in the context of Machine Learning?
What are the steps in the SISA approach?
What is Membership Inference Attack (MIA) used for?
options: To classify between training and unseen data
questions.correctAnswer: To classify between training and unseen data

questions.text: What is the role of differential privacy?
options: To make the model forget everything
To make models indistinguishable with/without certain data points
questions.correctAnswer: To make models indistinguishable with/without certain data points

questions.text: Which benchmarks are used to evaluate unlearning in LLMs? (Select all that apply.)

Case: A hospital wants to share patient health data with research institutions to support public health studies. However, it must ensure that a patient's identity cannot be inferred. To achieve this, the hospital generates and sends aggregate statistics to the institute. Which form of unlearning is this?
Which isn’t a type of graph unlearning?
Which methods are used for Node unlearning? (Select all that apply.)

options: Raw training data stored in memory
Intermediate activation vectors captured during model execution
The model's loss values during training
questions.correctAnswer: Intermediate activation vectors captured during model execution
